snippet: HiGear, a peer-to-peer start-up that specialized in luxury and high-performance cars, announced its dissolution after four vehicles from participating owners were stolen.
abstract: HiGear, a peer-to-peer start-up that specialized in luxury and high-performance cars, announced its dissolution after four vehicles from participating owners were stolen.
lead_paragraph: Despite safeguards that included member screening, credit checks and driving-record assessments, thieves were able to defraud HiGear, a peer-to-peer car-sharing start-up in the Bay Area that specialized in high-performance and luxury vehicles. Using fraudulent identities, the thieves stole four cars with a combined value of $300,000, according to an e-mail sent to members by Ali Moiz, the company's chief executive. Read more »

headline.main: After Thefts, Luxury Car-Sharing Service Shuts Down
